description: From French député, from Late Latin deputatus (“appointed”).

entries.meaning: One appointed as the substitute of others, and empowered to act for them, in their name or their behalf; a substitute in office.
examples: The deputy sheriff was promoted after his senior retired.
As the deputy store manager, he is able to fire staff.
Synonyms: lieutenant, representative, delegate, vice, vicegerent

entries.meaning: (mining, historical) A person employed to install and remove props, brattices, etc. and to clear gas, for the safety of the miners.
(France) A member of the Chamber of Deputies, formerly called Corps Législatif.
(Ireland) a member of Dáil Éireann, or the title of a member of Dáil Éireann. (Normally capitalised in both cases).
examples: Eamon Ryan is a deputy in the Dáil.
At today's meeting, Deputy Ryan will speak on local issues.

entries.meaning: (US) a law enforcement officer who works for the county sheriff's office; a deputy sheriff or sheriff's deputy; the entry level rank in such an agency.
examples: The sheriff's deputies took the suspect into custody.
Deputy Jones was promoted to corporal today.

entries.meaning: (government) The name for a member of parliament in some countries.

verbs.description: deputy (third-person singular simple present deputies, present participle deputying, simple past and past participle deputied)
